definition: Schumann (name)/Robert Schumann (1810-1856), romantic composer
surname Shu
to stretch/to unfold/to relax/leisurely
handsome/large/long

sentences.english: Integrity and the driver of the tractor repaired, small weeks without village to find schumann.
sentences.chinese: 正直和司機小周把拖拉機修好，沒有進村去找舒曼。

sentences.english: An imbalance between Schumann and geomagnetic waves disrupts biorhythms.
sentences.chinese: 舒曼波和地磁波之間的不平衡干擾了生理節律。

sentences.english: Schumann made two principal demands of the prospective composer of string quartets.
sentences.chinese: 舒曼提出了兩個主要要求準作曲家的絃樂四重奏。

sentences.english: A year later, she, Langston Hughes, and Wallace Thurman organized the journal.
sentences.chinese: 一年後，她，蘭斯頓休斯和華萊士瑪舒曼雜誌舉辦。

sentences.english: Next season it even plans to perform a Schumann symphony.
sentences.chinese: 奧菲斯甚至計劃在下一季度演奏舒曼的交響曲。

sentences.english: One time she asked me to draw a picture to describe a piece by Schumann.
sentences.chinese: 有一次她著我繪畫一圖來描述一首舒曼的作品。

sentences.english: For schumann JiCheng, in order to maintain schumann and forced to battle personally.
sentences.chinese: 季誠迫不得已，爲了維護舒曼，只好親身上陣。

sentences.english: The second chapter briefs the creative style and characteristics of Schumann's piano cycle.
sentences.chinese: 第二章介紹了舒曼鋼琴套曲的創作風格及特徵。

sentences.english: Schuman was known for his piano concerto.
sentences.chinese: 舒曼以他的鋼琴協奏曲而著名。

sentences.english: I think that Schuman and Summer feel too much heat from China, and cling to a lesser opponent for the relief.
sentences.chinese: 我想舒曼是得中國焦慮症，因而貶損對方以求安慰。

sentences.english: The last moment, schumann secure integrity, forgo study time.
sentences.chinese: 最後關頭，舒曼放心不下正直，暫時放棄留學時機。

definition: Brahms (name)/Johannes Brahms (1833-1897), German romantic composer
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791), Austrian composer
Tchaikovsky (1840-1893), Russian composer
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
Frederic Chopin or Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin (1810-1849), Polish pianist and composer
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Johann Sebastian Bach (1685-1750), German composer
Ludwig van Beethoven (1770-1827), German composer
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Haydn (name)/Franz Joseph Haydn (1732-1809), Austrian classical composer
Ferenc (Franz) Liszt (1811-1886), Hungarian composer/Joseph Lister (1883-1897), British surgeon and bacteriologist
Strauss (name)/Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer/Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer
Alexander Scriabin (1872-1915), Russian composer and pianist
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
composer/songwriter
